action.action-desc: Mr. Duncan of Tennessee introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to extend the work opportunity tax credit and to provide such credit for hiring long-term unemployed individuals.

section.header: Extension of work opportunity tax credit and provision of credit for hiring long-term unemployed individuals

subsection.header: Extension of work opportunity tax credit
subsection.text: Section 51(c)(4)(B) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking December 31, 2013 and inserting December 31, 2015.

subsection.header: Credit allowed for hiring long-Term unemployed individuals

paragraph.text: Section 51(d)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking or at the end of subparagraph (H), by striking the period at the end of subparagraph (I) and inserting , or, and by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

Section 51(d) of such Code is amended by striking paragraph (14), by redesignating paragraphs (11), (12), and (13) as paragraphs (12), (13), and (14), respectively, and by inserting after paragraph (10) the following new paragraph:
The term qualified long-term unemployed individual means any individual who is certified by the designated local agency asâ€”

subparagraph.text: an individual in receipt of unemployment compensation under State or Federal law during the entire 26-week period ending on the hiring date, or
an individual unemployed for such period who would have received such compensation for such period but for having exhausted the right to such compensation.

paragraph.header: Credit limited to $1,000 for hiring of each long-term unemployed individual
paragraph.text: Section 51(b)(3) of such Code is amended by inserting ($2,500 in the case of any qualified long-term unemployed individual).

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to individuals who begin work for the employer after December 31, 2013.
